result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra S Cano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 AMENDED FROM Theft of Business Setting >$10,000, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation goals achieved - Agent may petition for early termination.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) - Agent may modify. Defendant to continue with recovery program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Debra S Cano in court with attorney Robert William Peterson.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with any of the victim's financial accounts.    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Debra S Cano in court with attorney Robert William Peterson.  Corinne Balter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
